Fourteen Valar, led by Manwë (the lord of winds) and Varda (the queen of the stars), entered the world to shape and govern its development.
The Valar, angelic beings created by Ilúvatar, entered Arda to shape its geography and natural features.
Eönwë, Ilúvatar's herald, led the Ainur to enter the newly formed world to shape and govern it.
The Ainur who had sung in harmony with Ilúvatar became the Valar, powerful beings tasked with shaping the world according to its intended design.

Fourteen Valar (singular: Vala) entered into the world they had created: Manwë (Lord of Winds), Varda (Queen of Stars), Ulmo (Ruler of Waters), Aulë (Master Craftsman), Oromë (Hunter), Irmo (Master of Dreams), Tulkas (Strongest among the Valar), Vána (Goddess of Youth), Namarie (the Mourner), Mandos (Judge of the Dead), Nienna (Mourning Goddess), Estë (Goddess of Rest), and Yavanna (Shepherdess of the Trees).
The Ainur entered the new world as the Valar, each contributing their powers to shape and develop Arda.
Fourteen Ainur chose to enter Eä and shape its destiny.
Ilúvatar appointed 14 Ainur as the Valar (Powers) to shape and govern the world.
The Ainur entered the world to shape its landscape, each contributing their unique abilities.
The Valar, powerful beings created by Ilúvatar, entered Eä to shape and govern the newly formed lands.
Fourteen Valar and two other powerful beings, known as the Blue Wizards, descended into Arda to shape its lands, seas, and mountains.
The Ainur descended onto the earth to shape its landscape, but their efforts were hindered by Melkor's malevolent forces.
The Ainur, now known as the Valar, entered the world they had created.
The Valar (angelic powers) entered the world, each taking on roles as guardians and shapers of the land.
The Ainur entered this realm to shape and order its lands, seas, and mountains.
Fourteen Valar, the chief among them being Manwë and Varda, entered Arda to shape its geography, flora, and fauna.
The Valar entered the world to shape its geography, oceans, mountains, and islands.
Fourteen of the most skilled Ainur, known as the Valar, entered Arda to shape its landscapes, oceans, and life forms.
Fourteen Valar entered Eä and shaped its various realms according to their wills.
Fourteen of the most powerful Ainur entered Eä, taking physical forms as the Valar.
The 15 Valar, mighty powers that governed various aspects of creation, descended upon Arda to shape its destiny.
Fourteen Valar were chosen to enter Arda to shape its physical world and govern its development.
The Valar, a group of powerful Ainur who participated in shaping the world, emerged.
The Ainur who had taken part in creating the world descended into it, taking on physical forms as the Valar and the Maiar (lesser angelic beings).
The Valar entered Arda to shape its mountains, seas, and lands.
The Valar entered Arda to shape it according to their individual domains: Manwë (air and wind), Varda (stars), Ulmo (water), Aulë (earth), Oromë (forest), Tulkas (strength), and others.
The Ainur entered the new world, shaping its landscapes and seas according to their own visions.
The Ainur who had sung with Ilúvatar entered the new world as Valar (powers) or Maiar (lesser angelic spirits).
The Ainur who chose to enter the world became known as the Valar, or powers of the world.

From their respective realms in Valinor (a blessed land separate from mortal lands), the Valar, powerful Ainur guided by Ilúvatar, began shaping the world according to the harmony they had established.
When the Valar entered Eä, they discovered the chaos Melkor had brought forth.
The Ainur entered Arda, becoming the Valar, or "Powers," who shaped the land according to their nature.
The Valar (those Ainur who entered the world to shape and govern it) took on various roles.
The Ainur took physical forms and entered the world as the Valar (singular: Vala).
